BodyName: Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate Committee of the Council of the City of New York to conduct a hearing on the expanding role of DNA evidence in law enforcement and its effect on the administration of the death penalty.
Items.MatterName: DNA, Effect on the administration of the death penalty.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States Congress to pass HR 4162, a bill sponsored by Representative Jesse Jackson, Jr. that calls for a seven-year moratorium on all government-sponsored executions in the United States, and urging Governor George Pataki to follow the lead of Governor George Ryan of Illinois and declare a moratorium in New York State.

Resolution calling upon the appropriate Committee of the Council of the City of New York to conduct a hearing on the expanding role of DNA evidence in law enforcement and its effect on the administration of the death penalty.
Items.MatterName: DNA, Effect on the administration of the death penalty.

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Perkins, Quinn & Lopez

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States Congress to pass HR 4162, a bill sponsored by Representative Jesse Jackson, Jr. that calls for a seven-year moratorium on all government-sponsored executions in the United States, and urging Governor George Pataki to follow the lead of Governor George Ryan of Illinois and declare a moratorium in New York State.
